posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: My team is trying to use Magic Motion on the krakenx60 motors on our elevator. I read the documentation on ctre web page, but still struggle with using Magic Motion. I tried to look for this topic on chief delphi, but there is only old information. Does anybody know the example code or something like this?

There is example code from CTRE here for MotionMagic: Phoenix6-Examples/java/MotionMagic at main · CrossTheRoadElec/Phoenix6-Examples · GitHub .

To help you out we’d need more info. Are the motors running without motion magic? How about just with PositionVoltage control? If they are running, what is wrong with how they are running?

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: Motors are running without Motion Magic. I’m running it with just closed loop controller
Can you attach a link with your code where you tried to use motion magic?

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: I started to write a code, but i got struggle with motors configs because in actual intake we have sparkmax motor, however i need to program it to a kraken because we are goin to switch it to kraken. I also didn’t inderstand how to find values for ks, ki and etc.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
There’s a great article in the WPILib documentation about tuning an elevator with motion profiling, including a simulation, in the WPILib documentation: Tuning a Vertical Elevator with Motion Profiling — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

You can certainly try to use SysID or reCalc to calculate gain values, but manual tuning is often simpler and good enough for FRC . The document above has a good simulation with a recommended procedure here .

I recommend using Tuner X to tune the values on the fly, it’s a super useful tool. You can change the values and configure the controllers immediately. Then you can put position and velocity on the graph, and even run the motor. Once you get it working well in Tuner X, I’d take the gain values and move them into the code.

link_counts.title: Tuning a Vertical Elevator with Motion Profiling — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
Tuning a Vertical Elevator with Motion Profiling — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Angelina
posts.cooked: Thank you for help. I have one more question. How should it work? Will it make movement more smooth? Or how?

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
Yes. It will be more smooth, and usually more accurate.

Using only PID will race to the target, so you can get really fast and not well controlled acceleration. Motion Magic will accelerate, cruise, and then decelerate.

The accuracy usually increases because the whole motion is planned ahead of time, with set velocity and position targets at timeslices throughout the motion. Under the hood you can think of it as two controllers running to correct the position and velocity constantly to match the planned motion.
